page.title: 16POLLUTION OF LOCAL RIVER,B.H
page.content: The River Roding is the only river running through Buckhurst Hill. The Roding is once again polluted. The first time was by a lorry crashing on a bridge on the M11. It spilled several gallons of chemicals into the river. The Thames Water Authority tried to stop the oil going into the River Thames ,as the River Roding leads to the Thames. So the pollution inspectors put absorbent "booms" into the water. But it rained, so the oil got underneath and some flowed into the Thames. A local said,"We have got a beautiful river and we want to keep it like that. It should be full of fish, but all we have is some kind of chemical. The locals ought to look after the river more."
